alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 2:43PM MST until February 26 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. The period of heaviest accumulation is expected between 11 PM Saturday through 11 AM Sunday. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Fredonia, Ganado, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Pinetop-Lakeside, Shonto, Show Low, Valle, Whiteriver and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 5 PM Saturday to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from 5 PM Saturday to 5 PM Sunday: Alpine 2 to 4 inches Buffalo Pass 2 to 4 inches Fredonia 1 to 3 inches Ganado 1 to 3 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches North Rim 4 to 6 inches Pinetop-Lkside 4 to 6 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches Show Low 3 to 5 inches Valle 2 to 4 inches Whiteriver 1 to 3 inches Window Rock 1 to 2 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
